feed.subtitle: Personal blog where I document my progress, experiences, projects and anything Infosec related.

entry.title: Hack The Box - Android-in-the-Middle
entry.summary: I’m back at it again with another little challenge from HackTheBox. This time it’s a crypto one, called Android-in-the-Middle. To know what we have to do and how to get the flag, let’s look at the code they give us in source.py : from Crypto.Cipher import AES from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes import hashlib import random import socketserver import signal FLAG = "HTB{--REDACTED--}"...

entry.title: Hack The Box - Juggling Facts
entry.summary: Today I was feeling inspired and decided to give a try to a HackTheBox challenge. I decided to go for the Juggling facts one. This is a Web challenge which was introduced in the HackTheBoo beginner competition and thus it has difficult Very Easy (I said I was inspired, not that I was going to solve some Enigma-level challenge, so calm down). Understanding the Website Apart from taking a look ...

entry.title: Try Hack Me - Advent of Cyber 4 (2022)

link.title: Try Hack Me - Advent of Cyber 4 (2022)

entry.summary: After waiting for a full year, it’s finally back! Try Hack Me is hosting their famous Advent of Cyber for the 4th time. It consists of a series of beginner challenges, which you can complete every day from the first of December until Christmas. I thought it would be cool to give it a go, so I’ll try to update everyday (or as soon as I can) for the different challenges I complete. They have a c...

entry.title: Reply Challenges - Don't Forget the Best Bits

link.title: Reply Challenges - Don't Forget the Best Bits

entry.summary: This post is an attempt to document what I learned during the crypto200 challenge organized by Reply Challenges last weekend. It was my first CTF and for sure not the last one!
